abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, with a likely sustainability. However, the
            institutional development impact was modest, since only a
            very small number of staff from the Boru Hatlari ile Petrol
            Tasima A.S.(BOTAS) - the state owned company authorized to
            operate oil and gas pipelines - were actually involved in
            the implementation of the study to optimize the feasibility
            of the proposed pipeline project. Despite the relatively
            small project, lessons suggest that BOTAS could have
            financed the study itself, but the Bank assistance was
            requested in order to enhance the credibility of the study.
            This strongly suggests that for the Bank, the operation
            proved an expensive project per dollar loaned. However, it
            places the Bank in a better position to evaluate the export
            pipelines from the Caspian region - both oil and gas - and
            possibly assist with their financing.
